intro: Ornithogalum nematophyllum, commonly known as the slender star-of-Bethlehem, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to southern Africa. It features narrow, grass-like leaves and produces clusters of small, white, star-shaped flowers during the spring and summer months. The plant belongs to the Asparagaceae family and is characterized by its bulbous root system. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a suitable choice for rock gardens and borders. Due to its ornamental value and unique appearance, it is often cultivated in gardens for its visual appeal.
